history.content: Yeah, make an appointment with an EECS advisor. Takes like 10 minutes. They're really helpful!
Yeah, make an appointment with an EECS advisor. Takes like 10 minutes. They're really helpful!

children.subject:
+1 to them for setting up this Piazza. In my opinion, it actually promotes a sense of community :) I mean sure there are trolls and a lot of posts aren't really advising-related, but I do think having open discourse among students is a good thing.

To the advisors: in the event that you ban off-topic threads in the near future, please consider making another Piazza (call it EECS 404, why not) for general discussion.
+1 I really appreciate Lily and Nicole coming on piazza on Christmas break and answering our questions. I don't have a single student or Professor who's done that.
+1 EECS advisors are the greatest people on earth.

history.content:
Thanks all! 

You can schedule an appointment with a major adviser to confirm completion of major requirements. If you're in CS use this link. If you're in EECS use this link. These are exciting (to us) and new because you can select "no preference" at the bottom to schedule an appointment with the first available adviser.

I am graduating Spring 2017 and by checking DARS and last semester's classes I should be done with all of my graduation requirements as of Fall 2016. Is there a way to receive official confirmation? Do I need to make an appointment with a counselor or email?
history.subject: Whats the best way to confirm completion of graduation requirements for CS Majors?
